description: Open one or multiple MDF files for the current mode (Single files, Batch processing, or Comparison).
Open all MDF files found recursively in a selected root folder.
Load a display configuration (channels tree and sub-windows layout) for the current opened file.
ui_location: File menu or Single files → Command buttons

description: Save current channel tree selection and all sub-windows (channels, colors, axes, enabled state) to a configuration file.
ui_location: File menu or Single files → Command buttons

description: Switch to Single files mode to open and process files individually.
Switch to Batch processing mode to process multiple files together (concatenate, stack, or bulk modify/export).
Switch to Comparison mode to compare channels across multiple opened files.
Enable or disable creation of multiple subplots when creating new windows.
Toggle linking the X-axis across subplots so zooming affects all sub-windows.
Enable or disable applying value-to-text conversions for channels.
Switch the default plot background color for new plots.
Set plot X-axis formatting to seconds, time (hh:mm:ss), or date (measurement start datetime).
Switch application theme between Dark and Light.
Control how signal samples are visually interconnected in Plot step mode.
Select interpolation mode for integer channels: repeat previous sample, linear, or hybrid.
action_sequence: select_option('0 - repeat previous sample'|'1 - linear interpolation'|'2 - hybrid interpolation')

description: Select interpolation mode for float channels: repeat previous sample or linear.
action_sequence: select_option('0 - repeat previous sample'|'1 - linear interpolation')

description: Open the online GUI help page.
Create a new Plot window using the checked channels from the selection tree.
ui_location: Single files → Command buttons or keyboard

description: Create a new Numeric window using the checked channels from the selection tree.
ui_location: Single files → Command buttons or keyboard

description: Create a new Tabular window using the checked channels from the selection tree.
ui_location: Single files → Command buttons or keyboard

description: Toggle fullscreen view for the current opened file (Single files mode).
Check all channels in the channels tree.
Uncheck all channels in the channels tree.
Open advanced search dialog to select channels using wildcard or regex and check them in the tree.
Define a pattern-based window that filters channels by name and optionally by value condition; saved in the window configuration.
ui_location: Single files → Advanced search & select dialog → Pattern based window tab

description: Switch channel tree between natural sorted list, grouped by internal file structure, or only selected channels.
ui_location: Single files → Channel tree display mode

description: Open pop-up window to view channel, conversion, and source metadata (CNBLOCK, CCBLOCK, SIBLOCK/CEBLOCK).
Rearrange plot sub-windows using drag and drop within the windows area.
Set integer numeric display format to physical, hex, or binary in Numeric window.
Choose float precision for displaying values in Numeric window.
Adjust timestamp using input box or slider to display instantaneous values at that time.
Search for channels with values matching criteria (raw or scaled, operator, target, direction) at/around a timestamp.
Open range editor for a signal from Numeric window.
Edit the color of selected signal(s) in Plot window.
Toggle grid lines in Plot window.
Fit Y-axis for all active channels while keeping current X-axis range.
Fit Y-axis for selected channels only while keeping current X-axis range.
Home view to show all signals in both X and Y (whole signals fit).
Zoom in on current cursor position with a fixed zoom level (0.1s/cm).
Zoom X-axis in (I) or out (O), centered on cursor if present.
Zoom to the defined range region if enabled.
Toggle the display of the statistics panel for plot channels.
Toggle a movable range region that shows delta values for channels.
Stack all active channels vertically to avoid overlap, keeping X-axis range.
Stack only selected channels vertically to avoid overlap.
Lock or unlock the left margin of the range region.
Toggle drawing signal samples as dots.
Move the cursor to the previous or next sample.
Insert a computed channel using operations/functions or an expression based on existing plot signals.
Toggle the display of trigger text boxes.
Toggle between raw and scaled samples for selected channels.
Toggle integer representation of channels between binary, hex, and physical.
Insert a vertical line and a comment at the current cursor position.
Open dialog to edit color ranges for a channel or channel group.
Visually edit Y-axis ranges according to expected signal values.
Save channels from the current active subplot to a new MF4 file.
Save all channels from all sub-windows to a new MF4 file.
Cascade all plot sub-windows.
Toggle MDI window frames for subplots.
Toggle visibility of the channel selection tree for the current file.
Tile sub-windows in a grid.
Tile sub-windows vertically.
Tile sub-windows horizontally.
Shift selected channels left/right in time or up/down in Y.
Adjust each vertical axis width using + and - buttons.
Change a signal color using the color select button next to it in the selection tree.
Assign signals to a common Y-axis using the common axis checkbox.
Assign a signal to its own individual Y-axis.
Create a simple channel group for organizing signals in the selection tree.
ui_location: Plot window → signal selection tree context menu

description: Create a pattern-based channel group to filter signals by name or sample values.
ui_location: Plot window → signal selection tree context menu

description: Open range editor dialog for a signal from the Plot window by double-clicking its item.
Define one or multiple filters for signals in Tabular window.
Sort, define signal ranges, and adjust column width via column header right-click menu.
Choose integer display format (physical, hex, binary) in Tabular window.
Set float precision for Tabular display.
Display timestamps as float or datetime.
Remove prefixes from column names to reduce column width.
Toggle visibility of the filters panel in Tabular window.
Run a pandas-like query on the underlying dataframe to filter displayed data.
Create CAN/LIN/FlexRay Bus Trace window from current selection if measurement contains corresponding bus logging.
action_sequence: select_option('CAN Bus Trace'|'LIN Bus Trace'|'FlexRay Bus Trace')

description: Decode CAN/LIN bus logging using database files (.dbc, .ldf, .arxml).
ui_location: Single files → bus logging tab or Batch processing → bus logging tab

description: Extract and save attachments embedded in the measurement file.
View file overview including channel groups, header comments, and total channel count.
Filter channels included in the output during modify & export operations.
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Cut measurement to a specified time interval.
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Resample the measurement to a new sampling rate or grid.
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Convert the measurement to another supported format (e.g., MF4, CSV, HDF5).
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Export channels to CSV format.
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Export channels to HDF5 format.
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Scramble the measurement data (obfuscation).
ui_location: Single files → modify & export tab or Batch processing → modify & export tab

description: Concatenate multiple MDF files into a single file; requires matching internal structure. Optionally synchronize using measurement timestamps.
Stack multiple files into a single measurement containing all channel groups; identically named channels are not concatenated.
Delete unwanted files from batch list using DEL key.
Reorder files in batch list via drag and drop; order is top to bottom.
Search channels across all opened files; channel names are prefixed with measurement index.
Drag and drop channels between sub-windows or into free MDI area to create new windows.
Activate the plot cursor by clicking in the plot area; enables live value readouts.
Move range region margins: left margin by click; right margin by Ctrl+click.
Create a GPS window from selected channels when available.
Display X-axis as seconds, time, or date in existing plots via Settings (affects new plots; existing may not change).
Create new Numeric, Plot, Tabular, GPS, or Bus Trace windows from checked channels via the Create window button.
action_sequence: select_option('Numeric'|'Plot'|'Tabular'|'GPS'|'CAN Bus Trace'|'LIN Bus Trace'|'FlexRay Bus Trace')

description: Create a new subplot if Sub-windows is enabled; otherwise replace the current window.
View current or delta values in the signal selection tree when cursor or range is active.
